03663          : recv_string
03664 
03665   Purpose: Receive network data over TCP port. Since sockets are
03666      operated in stream mode, a single transmission via send
03667      may not transfer the full data. Therefore, one has to check
03668      at the receiver side if the full data is received. If not,
03669      one has to issue several recv() commands.
03670 
03671      The length of the data is determined by a trailing zero.
03672 
03673   Input:
03674     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
03675     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
03676     INT   millisec           Timeout in ms
03677 
03678   Output:
03679     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
03680 
03681   Function value:
03682     INT                      String length
03683 
03684 \********************************************************************/
03685 {
03686    INT i, status;
03687    DWORD n;
03688    fd_set readfds;
03689    struct timeval timeout;
03690 
03691    n = 0;
03692    memset(buffer, 0, buffer_size);
03693 
03694    do {
03695       if (millisec > 0) {
03696          FD_ZERO(&readfds);
03697          FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
03698 
03699          timeout.tv_sec = millisec / 1000;
03700          timeout.tv_usec = (millisec % 1000) * 1000;
03701 
03702          do {
03703             status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
03704 
03705             /* if an alarm signal was cought, restart select with reduced timeout */
03706             if (status == -1 && timeout.tv_sec >= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000)
03707                timeout.tv_sec -= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000;
03708 
03709          } while (status == -1);        /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
03710 
03711          if (!FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds))
03712             break;
03713       }
03714 
03715       i = recv(sock, buffer + n, 1, 0);
03716 
03717       if (i <= 0)
03718          break;
03719 
03720       n++;
03721 
03722       if (n >= buffer_size)
03723          break;
03724 
03725    } while (buffer[n - 1] && buffer[n - 1] != 10);
03726 
03727    return n - 1;
03728 }

03734          : recv_tcp
03735 
03736   Purpose: Receive network data over TCP port. Since sockets are
03737      operated in stream mode, a single transmission via send
03738      may not transfer the full data. Therefore, one has to check
03739      at the receiver side if the full data is received. If not,
03740      one has to issue several recv() commands.
03741 
03742      The length of the data is determined by the data header,
03743      which consists of two DWORDs. The first is the command code
03744      (or function id), the second is the size of the following
03745      parameters in bytes. From that size recv_tcp() determines
03746      how much data to receive.
03747 
03748   Input:
03749     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
03750     char  *net_buffer        Buffer to store data to
03751     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
03752     INT   flags              Flags passed to recv()
03753 
03754   Output:
03755     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
03756 
03757   Function value:
03758     INT                      Same as recv()
03759 
03760 \********************************************************************/
03761 {
03762    INT param_size, n_received, n;
03763    NET_COMMAND *nc;
03764 
03765    if (buffer_size < sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER)) {
03766       cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp", "parameters too large for network buffer");
03767       return -1;
03768    }
03769 
03770    /* first receive header */
03771    n_received = 0;
03772    do {
03773 #ifdef OS_UNIX
03774       do {
03775          n = recv(sock, net_buffer + n_received, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER), flags);
03776 
03777          /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
03778       } while (n == -1 && errno == EINTR);
03779 #else
03780       n = recv(sock, net_buffer + n_received, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER), flags);
03781 #endif
03782 
03783       if (n <= 0) {
03784          cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp",
03785                 "header: recv returned %d, n_received = %d, errno: %d (%s)",
03786                 n, n_received, errno, strerror(errno));
03787          return n;
03788       }
03789 
03790       n_received += n;
03791 
03792    } while (n_received < sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER));
03793 
03794    /* now receive parameters */
03795 
03796    nc = (NET_COMMAND *) net_buffer;
03797    param_size = nc->header.param_size;
03798    n_received = 0;
03799 
03800    if (param_size == 0)
03801       return sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER);
03802 
03803    do {
03804 #ifdef OS_UNIX
03805       do {
03806          n = recv(sock,
03807                   net_buffer + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + n_received,
03808                   param_size - n_received, flags);
03809 
03810          /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
03811       } while (n == -1 && errno == EINTR);
03812 #else
03813       n = recv(sock, net_buffer + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + n_received,
03814                param_size - n_received, flags);
03815 #endif
03816 
03817       if (n <= 0) {
03818          cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp",
03819                 "param: recv returned %d, n_received = %d, errno: %d (%s)",
03820                 n, n_received, errno, strerror(errno));
03821          return n;
03822       }
03823 
03824       n_received += n;
03825    } while (n_received < param_size);
03826 
03827    return sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + param_size;
03828 }

03961          : recv_udp
03962 
03963   Purpose: Receive network data over UDP port. If received event
03964      is splitted into several buffers, recombine them checking
03965      the serial number. If one buffer is missing in a splitted
03966      event, throw away the whole event.
03967 
03968   Input:
03969     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
03970     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
03971     INT   flags              Flags passed to recv()
03972 
03973   Output:
03974     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
03975 
03976   Function value:
03977     INT                     Same as recv()
03978 
03979 \********************************************************************/
03980 {
03981    INT i, status;
03982    UDP_HEADER *udp_header;
03983    char udp_buffer[NET_UDP_SIZE];
03984    DWORD serial_number, sequence_number, total_buffer_size;
03985    DWORD data_size, n_received;
03986    fd_set readfds;
03987    struct timeval timeout;
03988 
03989    udp_header = (UDP_HEADER *) udp_buffer;
03990    data_size = NET_UDP_SIZE - sizeof(UDP_HEADER);
03991 
03992    /* Receive the first buffer */
03993 #ifdef OS_UNIX
03994    do {
03995       i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
03996 
03997       /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
03998    } while (i == -1 && errno == EINTR);
03999 #else
04000    i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04001 #endif
04002 
04003  start:
04004 
04005    /* Receive buffers until we get a sequence start */
04006    while (!(udp_header->serial_number & UDP_FIRST)) {
04007       /* wait for data with timeout */
04008       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
04009       FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
04010 
04011       timeout.tv_sec = 0;
04012       timeout.tv_usec = 100000; /* 0.1 s */
04013 
04014       do {
04015          status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
04016       } while (status == -1);
04017 
04018       /*
04019          If we got nothing, return zero so that calling program can do
04020          other things like checking TCP port for example.
04021        */
04022       if (!FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds))
04023          return 0;
04024 
04025 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04026       do {
04027          i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04028 
04029          /* dont return if an alarm signal was caught */
04030       } while (i == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04031 #else
04032       i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04033 #endif
04034    }
04035 
04036    /* if no others are following, return */
04037    total_buffer_size = udp_header->serial_number & ~UDP_FIRST;
04038    serial_number = udp_header->sequence_number;
04039    sequence_number = 0;
04040 
04041    if (total_buffer_size <= data_size) {
04042       if (buffer_size < total_buffer_size) {
04043          memcpy(buffer, udp_header + 1, buffer_size);
04044          return buffer_size;
04045       } else {
04046          memcpy(buffer, udp_header + 1, total_buffer_size);
04047          return total_buffer_size;
04048       }
04049    }
04050 
04051    /* if others are following, collect them */
04052    n_received = data_size;
04053 
04054    if (buffer_size < data_size) {
04055       memcpy(buffer, udp_header + 1, buffer_size);
04056       return buffer_size;
04057    }
04058 
04059    memcpy(buffer, udp_header + 1, data_size);
04060 
04061 
04062    do {
04063       /* wait for new data with timeout */
04064       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
04065       FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
04066 
04067       timeout.tv_sec = 0;
04068       timeout.tv_usec = 100000; /* 0.1 s */
04069 
04070       do {
04071          status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
04072       } while (status == -1);
04073 
04074       /*
04075          If we got nothing, return zero so that calling program can do
04076          other things like checking TCP port for example.
04077        */
04078       if (!FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds))
04079          return 0;
04080 
04081 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04082       do {
04083          i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04084 
04085          /* dont return if an alarm signal was caught */
04086       } while (i == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04087 #else
04088       i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04089 #endif
04090 
04091       sequence_number++;
04092 
04093       /* check sequence and serial numbers */
04094       if (udp_header->serial_number != serial_number ||
04095           udp_header->sequence_number != sequence_number)
04096          /* lost one, so start again */
04097          goto start;
04098 
04099       /* copy what we got */
04100       memcpy(buffer + n_received, udp_header + 1, i - sizeof(UDP_HEADER));
04101 
04102       n_received += (i - sizeof(UDP_HEADER));
04103 
04104    } while (n_received < total_buffer_size);
04105 
04106    return n_received;
04107 }

03609          : send_tcp
03610 
03611   Purpose: Send network data over TCP port. Break buffer in smaller
03612            parts if larger than maximum TCP buffer size (usually 64k).
03613 
03614   Input:
03615     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
03616     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
03617     INT   flags              Flags passed to send()
03618 
03619   Output:
03620     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
03621 
03622   Function value:
03623     INT                     Same as send()
03624 
03625 \********************************************************************/
03626 {
03627    DWORD count;
03628    INT status;
03629 
03630    /* transfer fragments until complete buffer is transferred */
03631 
03632    for (count = 0; (INT) count < (INT) buffer_size - NET_TCP_SIZE;) {
03633       status = send(sock, buffer + count, NET_TCP_SIZE, flags);
03634       if (status != -1)
03635          count += status;
03636       else {
03637          cm_msg(MERROR, "send_tcp",
03638                 "send(socket=%d,size=%d) returned %d, errno: %d (%s)",
03639                 sock, NET_TCP_SIZE, status, errno, strerror(errno));
03640          return status;
03641       }
03642    }
03643 
03644    while (count < buffer_size) {
03645       status = send(sock, buffer + count, buffer_size - count, flags);
03646       if (status != -1)
03647          count += status;
03648       else {
03649          cm_msg(MERROR, "send_tcp",
03650                 "send(socket=%d,size=%d) returned %d, errno: %d (%s)",
03651                 sock, (int) (buffer_size - count), status, errno, strerror(errno));
03652          return status;
03653       }
03654    }
03655 
03656    return count;
03657 }

INT send_udp ( int  sock,
char *  buffer,

)

Definition at line 3831 of file system.c.

References data_size, NET_UDP_SIZE, send(), UDP_HEADER::sequence_number, UDP_HEADER::serial_number, serial_number, status, and UDP_FIRST.

03834          : send_udp
03835 
03836   Purpose: Send network data over UDP port. If buffer_size is small,
03837      collect several events and send them together. If
03838      buffer_size is larger than largest datagram size
03839      NET_UDP_SIZE, split event in several udp buffers and
03840      send them separately with serial number protection.
03841 
03842   Input:
03843     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
03844     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
03845     INT   flags              Flags passed to send()
03846 
03847   Output:
03848     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
03849 
03850   Function value:
03851     INT                     Same as send()
03852 
03853 \********************************************************************/
03854 {
03855    INT status;
03856    UDP_HEADER *udp_header;
03857    static char udp_buffer[NET_UDP_SIZE];
03858    static INT serial_number = 0, n_received = 0;
03859    DWORD i, data_size;
03860 
03861    udp_header = (UDP_HEADER *) udp_buffer;
03862    data_size = NET_UDP_SIZE - sizeof(UDP_HEADER);
03863 
03864    /*
03865       If buffer size is between half the UPD size and full UDP size,
03866       send immediately a single packet.
03867     */
03868    if (buffer_size >= NET_UDP_SIZE / 2 && buffer_size <= data_size) {
03869       /*
03870          If there is any data already in the buffer, send it first.
03871        */
03872       if (n_received) {
03873          udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | n_received;
03874          udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
03875 
03876          send(sock, udp_buffer, n_received + sizeof(UDP_HEADER), flags);
03877          n_received = 0;
03878       }
03879 
03880       udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | buffer_size;
03881       udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
03882 
03883       memcpy(udp_header + 1, buffer, buffer_size);
03884       status = send(sock, udp_buffer, buffer_size + sizeof(UDP_HEADER), flags);
03885       if (status == (INT) buffer_size + (int) sizeof(UDP_HEADER))
03886          status -= sizeof(UDP_HEADER);
03887 
03888       return status;
03889    }
03890 
03891    /*
03892       If buffer size is smaller than half the UDP size, collect events
03893       until UDP buffer is optimal filled.
03894     */
03895    if (buffer_size <= data_size) {
03896       /* If udp_buffer has space, just copy it there */
03897       if (buffer_size + n_received < data_size) {
03898          memcpy(udp_buffer + sizeof(UDP_HEADER) + n_received, buffer, buffer_size);
03899 
03900          n_received += buffer_size;
03901          return buffer_size;
03902       }
03903 
03904       /* If udp_buffer has not enough space, send it */
03905       udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | n_received;
03906       udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
03907 
03908       status = send(sock, udp_buffer, n_received + sizeof(UDP_HEADER), flags);
03909 
03910       n_received = 0;
03911 
03912       memcpy(udp_header + 1, buffer, buffer_size);
03913       n_received = buffer_size;
03914 
03915       return buffer_size;
03916    }
03917 
03918    /*
03919       If buffer size is larger than UDP size, split event in several
03920       buffers.
03921     */
03922 
03923    /* If there is any data already in the buffer, send it first */
03924    if (n_received) {
03925       udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | n_received;
03926       udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
03927 
03928       send(sock, udp_buffer, n_received + sizeof(UDP_HEADER), flags);
03929       n_received = 0;
03930    }
03931 
03932    for (i = 0; i < ((buffer_size - 1) / data_size); i++) {
03933       if (i == 0) {
03934          udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | buffer_size;
03935          udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
03936       } else {
03937          udp_header->serial_number = serial_number;
03938          udp_header->sequence_number = i;
03939       }
03940 
03941       memcpy(udp_header + 1, buffer + i * data_size, data_size);
03942       send(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
03943    }
03944 
03945    /* Send remaining bytes */
03946    udp_header->serial_number = serial_number;
03947    udp_header->sequence_number = i;
03948    memcpy(udp_header + 1, buffer + i * data_size, buffer_size - i * data_size);
03949    status =
03950        send(sock, udp_buffer, sizeof(UDP_HEADER) + buffer_size - i * data_size, flags);
03951    if ((DWORD) status == sizeof(UDP_HEADER) + buffer_size - i * data_size)
03952       return buffer_size;
03953 
03954    return status;
03955 }

DWORD ss_millitime ( void   ) 

dox Returns the actual time in milliseconds with an arbitrary origin. This time may only be used to calculate relative times.

Overruns in the 32 bit value don't hurt since in a subtraction calculated with 32 bit accuracy this overrun cancels (you may think about!).. 

...
DWORD start, stop:
start = ss_millitime();
  < do operations >
stop = ss_millitime();
printf("Operation took %1.3lf seconds\n",(stop-start)/1000.0);
...
Returns:
millisecond time stamp.

01823   Purpose: Create a mutex with a specific name

01827             the POSIX-compatible semaphore interface.

01829             So for the time being, we keep the pure VxWorks
01830             The semaphore type is a Binary instead of mutex
01831             as the binary is an optimized mutex.

01854       refering to the programmer's Guide 5.3.1 */

01875    strcat(file_name, ".");      /* dot file under UNIX */
01876 #endif
01877    strcat(file_name, name);
01878    strcat(file_name, ".SHM");
01879 
01880 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01881 
01882    *mutex_handle = (HNDLE) CreateMutex(NULL, FALSE, mutex_name);
01883 
01884    if (*mutex_handle == 0)
01885       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
01886 
01887    return SS_CREATED;
01888 
01889 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01890 #ifdef OS_VMS

01895       INT status;

01898       mutexname_dsc.dsc$a_pointer = mutex_name;

01901 
01902       status = sys$enqw(0, LCK$K_NLMODE, *mutex_handle, 0, &mutexname_dsc,
01903                         0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
01904

01906          free((void *) *mutex_handle);
01907          *mutex_handle = 0;
01908       }
01909 
01910       if (*mutex_handle == 0)
01911          return SS_NO_MUTEX;

01928          struct semid_ds *buf;
01929          ushort *array;

01934 
01935       /* create a unique key from the file name */
01936       key = ftok(file_name, 'M');
01937       if (key < 0) {
01938          fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT, 0644);
01939          close(fh);
01940          key = ftok(file_name, 'M');
01941          status = SS_CREATED;
01942       }
01943 
01944       /* create or get semaphore */
01945       *mutex_handle = (HNDLE) semget(key, 1, 0);
01946       if (*mutex_handle < 0) {
01947          *mutex_handle = (HNDLE) semget(key, 1, IPC_CREAT);
01948          status = SS_CREATED;
01949       }
01950 
01951       if (*mutex_handle < 0) {
01952          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_mutex_mutex", "semget() failed, errno = %d", errno);
01953          return SS_NO_MUTEX;
01954       }
01955 
01956       buf.sem_perm.uid = getuid();
01957       buf.sem_perm.gid = getgid();
01958       buf.sem_perm.mode = 0666;
01959       arg.buf = &buf;
01960 
01961       semctl(*mutex_handle, 0, IPC_SET, arg);
01962 
01963       /* if semaphore was created, set value to one */
01964       if (status == SS_CREATED) {
01965          arg.val = 1;
01966          if (semctl(*mutex_handle, 0, SETVAL, arg) < 0)
01967             return SS_NO_MUTEX;
01968       }
01969 
01970       return SS_SUCCESS;
01971    }
01972 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
01973 
01974 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
01975    return SS_NO_MUTEX;
01976 #endif
01977 }

01342             break;
01343 
01344          if (dwRead > 0) {
01345             ReadFile(hChildStderrRd, buffer, 256, &dwRead, NULL);
01346             send(sock, buffer, dwRead, 0);
01347          }
01348       } while (dwAvail > 0);
01349 
01350       /* query stdout */
01351       do {
01352          if (!PeekNamedPipe(hChildStdoutRd, buffer, 256, &dwRead, &dwAvail, NULL))
01353             break;
01354          if (dwRead > 0) {
01355             ReadFile(hChildStdoutRd, buffer, 256, &dwRead, NULL);
01356             send(sock, buffer, dwRead, 0);
01357          }
01358       } while (dwAvail > 0);
01359 
01360 
01361       /* check if subprocess still alive */
01362       if (!GetExitCodeProcess(piProcInfo.hProcess, &i))
01363          break;
01364       if (i != STILL_ACTIVE)
01365          break;
01366 
01367       /* query network socket */
01368       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
01369       FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
01370       timeout.tv_sec = 0;
01371       timeout.tv_usec = 100;
01372       select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
01373 
01374       if (FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
01375          i = recv(sock, cmd + i_cmd, 1, 0);
01376          if (i <= 0)
01377             break;
01378 
01379          /* backspace */
01380          if (cmd[i_cmd] == 8) {
01381             if (i_cmd > 0) {
01382                send(sock, "\b \b", 3, 0);
01383                i_cmd -= 1;
01384             }
01385          } else if (cmd[i_cmd] >= ' ' || cmd[i_cmd] == 13 || cmd[i_cmd] == 10) {
01386             send(sock, cmd + i_cmd, 1, 0);
01387             i_cmd += i;
01388          }
01389       }
01390 
01391       /* linefeed triggers new command */
01392       if (cmd[i_cmd - 1] == 10) {
01393          WriteFile(hChildStdinWrDup, cmd, i_cmd, &dwWritten, NULL);
01394          i_cmd = 0;
01395       }
01396 
01397    } while (TRUE);
01398 
01399    CloseHandle(hChildStdinWrDup);
01400    CloseHandle(hChildStdinRd);
01401    CloseHandle(hChildStderrRd);
01402    CloseHandle(hChildStdoutRd);
01403 
01404    return SS_SUCCESS;
01405 
01406 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01407 
01408 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01409 #ifndef NO_PTY
01410    pid_t pid;
01411    int i, pipe;
01412    char line[32], buffer[1024], shell[32];
01413    fd_set readfds;
01414 
01415    if ((pid = forkpty(&pipe, line, NULL, NULL)) < 0)
01416       return 0;
01417    else if (pid > 0) {
01418       /* parent process */
01419 
01420       do {
01421          FD_ZERO(&readfds);
01422          FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
01423          FD_SET(pipe, &readfds);
01424 
01425          select(FD_SETSIZE, (void *) &readfds, NULL, NULL, NULL);
01426 
01427          if (FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
01428             memset(buffer, 0, sizeof(buffer));
01429             i = recv(sock, buffer, sizeof(buffer), 0);
01430             if (i <= 0)
01431                break;
01432             if (write(pipe, buffer, i) != i)
01433                break;
01434          }
01435 
01436          if (FD_ISSET(pipe, &readfds)) {
01437             memset(buffer, 0, sizeof(buffer));
01438             i = read(pipe, buffer, sizeof(buffer));
01439             if (i <= 0)
01440                break;
01441             send(sock, buffer, i, 0);
01442          }
01443 
01444       } while (1);
01445    } else {
01446       /* child process */
01447 
01448       if (getenv("SHELL"))
01449          strlcpy(shell, getenv("SHELL"), sizeof(shell));
01450       else
01451          strcpy(shell, "/bin/sh");
01452       execl(shell, shell, 0);
01453    }
01454 #else
01455    send(sock, "not implemented\n", 17, 0);
01456 #endif                          /* NO_PTY */
01457 
01458    return SS_SUCCESS;
01459 
01460 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
01461 }

INT ss_sleep ( INT  millisec  ) 

dox Suspend the calling process for a certain time.

The function is similar to the sleep() function, but has a resolution of one milliseconds. Under VxWorks the resolution is 1/60 of a second. It uses the socket select() function with a time-out. See examples in ss_time()

Parameters:
millisec Time in milliseconds to sleep. Zero means infinite (until another process calls ss_wake)
Returns:
SS_SUCCESS

\encode
@param command Command to execute.
@return SS_SUCCESS or ss_exec() return code
*/
INT ss_system(char *command)
{
#ifdef OS_UNIX
   INT childpid;

   return ss_exec(command, &childpid);

#else

   system(command);
   return SS_SUCCESS;

#endif
}

#ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS

/*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
INT ss_exec(char *command, INT * pid)
/********************************************************************\

  Routine: ss_exec

  Purpose: Execute command in a separate process, close all open
           file descriptors, return the pid of the child process.

  Input:
    char * command    Command to execute
    INT  * pid        Returned PID of the spawned process.
  Output:
    none

  Function value:
    SS_SUCCESS       Successful completion
    SS_ABORT         fork() was not successful, or other problem

\********************************************************************/
{
#ifdef OS_UNIX

   /* only implemented for UNIX */
   int i, fd;

   if ((*pid = fork()) < 0)
      return SS_ABORT;
   else if (*pid != 0) {
      /* avoid <defunc> parent processes */
      signal(SIGCHLD, catch_sigchld);
      return SS_SUCCESS;        /* parent returns */
   }

   /* child continues here... */

   /* close all open file descriptors */
   for (i = 0; i < 256; i++)
      close(i);

   /* try and use up stdin, stdout and stderr, so other
      routines writing to stdout etc won't cause havoc */
   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
      fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR, 0);
      if (fd < 0)
         fd = open("/dev/null", O_WRONLY, 0);
      if (fd < 0) {
         cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_exec", "Can't open /dev/null");
         return SS_ABORT;
      }
      if (fd != i) {
         cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_exec", "Did not get file descriptor");
         return SS_ABORT;
      }
   }

   setsid();                    /* become session leader */
   /* chdir("/"); *//* change working directory (not on NFS!) */
   umask(0);                    /* clear our file mode createion mask */

   /* execute command */
   execl("/bin/sh", "sh", "-c", command, NULL);

#else

   system(command);

#endif

   return SS_SUCCESS;
}

#endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */

/********************************************************************/

INT ss_thread_kill ( midas_thread_t  thread_id  )

02651       return SS_NO_PROCESS;

02654
